Description:
Job Summary:The Jira Developer will be responsible for the development, implementation, and maintenance of Jira software for the organization. The developer will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain Jira workflows, custom fields, screens, dashboards, and plugins that support the organization's business processes and requirements.Key Responsibilities:Develop, customize, and maintain Jira workflows, custom fields, screens, dashboards, and plugins to support the organization's business processes and requirements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design Jira solutions that meet business needs.
Develop and maintain Jira integrations with other systems and tools, such as Confluence, Bitbucket, and Jenkins.
Configure and maintain Jira permissions, roles, and security settings.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for Jira users and administrators.
Stay up-to-date with Jira software updates, new features, and best practices.
Develop and maintain Jira documentation, including user guides, technical documentation, and training materials.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, such as sprint planning and retrospectives, and contribute to the continuous improvement of the development process.Skills
Skills:
Jira certification (e.g., Atlassian Certified Jira Administrator, Atlassian Certified Jira Developer).
Experience with Atlassian tools, such as Confluence, Bitbucket, and Bamboo.
Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools, such as Git, Jenkins, and Docker.
Experience with cloud-based Jira solutions, such as Jira Cloud and Jira Service Management.
Familiarity with project management tools, such as Trello and Asana

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in Jira development and administration.
Strong knowledge of Jira workflows, custom fields, screens, dashboards, and plugins.
Excellent programming skills in Java, JavaScript, and Groovy.
Experience with Jira APIs and integrations with other systems and tools.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies, such as Scrum and Kanban.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
